alert.note: Alert for Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 08 at 10:46PM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, the central Inner Channel, portions of the eastern Gulf Coast, and portions of the northern Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Juneau, Gustavus, Hoonah, Elfin Cove, Pelican, Angoon, Petersburg, Wrangell, And Kake. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Rain and snowmelt may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with snow. Mariners should be aware of their vessels filling with water and sinking if moored and take action to remove excess water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to heavy rainfall has already begun across the area and will persist through Wednesday evening. Twenty-four hour rain amounts ending Tuesday evening have ranged between 1 and 2 inches with locally higher amounts. We expect 1.5 to 3 more inches of rainfall through Wednesday evening. Rain on the snowpack will increase the runoff and may result in ponding of water on roads and low lying areas.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
